castles.name: Jigginstown Castle
castles.description: Built for Black Tom Strafford, Lord Lieutenant of Ireland. The castle was never finished.

castles.name: Carlow Castle
castles.description: The ruins of a medieval castle & military stronghold featuring 2 towers, a wall & gardens.

reviews.text: It's great right now if you like scaffolding.
The Castle is well preserved and worth a quick visit.

newCastle.name: Brize Castle
newCastle.description: It was built by Gerald Mc Maurice, the younger son of Maurice de Prenderghast, who accompanied Richard Strongbow in the Anglo/Norman invasion of Ireland in 1169 and was rewarded with lands in Ireland in Waterford, Wexford, Tipperary, Mayo and Wicklow.

editCastle.name: The Brize Castle
editCastle.description: It was DEFINITELY built by Gerald Mc Maurice, the younger son of Maurice de Prenderghast, who accompanied Richard Strongbow in the Anglo/Norman invasion of Ireland in 1169 and was rewarded with lands in Ireland in Waterford, Wexford, Tipperary, Mayo and Wicklow.

newReview.text: There is NO Castle just a pile of stones
